item.title: Conceptual Representations of Culturally-loaded Animals in Bilinguals
item.description: This project has been published on the Journal of Cultural Cognitive Science: Pan, X. & Jared, D. (2021). Cross-language activation of culture-specific features in Chinese-English bilinguals. Journal of Cultural Cognitive Science, 5, 325–344. and has been presented at the Psychonomics Society 2019 Annual Meeting, Montréal, Canada: Pan, X., & Jared, D. (2019, November). Conceptual representations of culturally-loaded animals in Chinese-English bilinguals. The Psychonomics Society 2019 Annual Meeting, Montréal, Canada.

item.title: Transposed Radical Priming Effect in Chinese
item.description: This project has been presented at the Canadian Society for Brain, Behaviour and Cognitive Science 2019 annual meeting, Waterloo, Canada, the Psychonomics Society 2018 Annual Meeting, New Orleans, USA, and the Psychonomics Society 2017 Annual Meeting, Vancouver, Canada: Chi, Z., Pan, X., & Lupker, S. (2019, June). The flexibility of radical position coding in Chinese character recognition: Evidence from transposed radical priming effects. Canadian Society for Brain, Behaviour and Cognitive Science, Waterloo, Canada.

item.title: Lexical Conceptual Representations in Bicultural Bilinguals
item.description: This project has been published on Bilingualism: Language and Cognition: Pan, X., Xiong, A., Jouravlev, O., & Jared, D. (2021). Conceptual representations in bicultural bilinguals: An ERP approach. Bilingualism: Language and Cognition, 24(5), 932–944. and has been presented at the Psychonomics Society 2015 Annual Meeting, Chicago, USA: Jared, D., Xiong, A., Pan, X., & Jouravlev, O. (2015, November). Lexical conceptual representations in bicultural bilinguals. The Psychonomics Society 2015 Annual Meeting, Chicago, USA.

item.title: Effects of Linguistic Labels on Object Categorization and Perception.
item.description: This project has been published on Bilingualism: Language and Cognition amd Language and Cognition: Pan, X., & Jared, D. (2021). Effects of Chinese word structure on object perception in Chinese- English bilinguals: Evidence from an ERP visual oddball paradigm. Bilingualism: Language and Cognition, 24(1), 111–123. Pan, X., & Jared, D. (2020). Effects of Chinese word structure on object categorization in Chinese-English bilinguals.
